18 st by 18 row stitch explanation k knit k2tog knit 2 together p purl mc main colour st / sts sqtches cc contrast colour ssk slip-slip-knit size should fit a 21 22 5 average adult head laying flat 9 ½ 24cm across and 9 ½ 24cm tall skull fair isle toque © stashbusters union 2025 2 chart notes all sqtches of the chart are knit sqtches worked right to le_ and bobble`om to top **where there is a colour block of more than 5 sqtches 5+ sqtches of the same colour in a row i like to wrap the working yarn once around the non-working yarn in the middle of the block to anchor the float** pattern ribbing in mc with 4 0mm us 6 needles cast on 88 sqtches using the long-tail cast-on or your favourite stretchy cast-on place marker and join in the round round 1 k2 p2 around repeat first round 11 more qmes or unql ribbing is approximately 2 5cm main hat body complete the chart there will be 11 repeats of the 8-sqtch pa`ern around the hat once chart is complete knit around with mc unql hat measures 10 5 27cm from cast-on decreases complete the decreases as follows switching to dpns when needed 1 ssk k1 k2tog k17 four qmes 80 sts 2 ssk k1 k2tog k15 four qmes 72 sts 3 ssk k1 k2tog k13 four qmes 64 sts 4 ssk k1 k2tog k11 four qmes 56 sts 5 ssk k1 k2tog k9 four qmes 48 sts 6 ssk k1 k2tog k7 four qmes 40 sts 7 ssk k1 k2tog k5 four qmes 32 sts 8 ssk k1 k2tog k3 four qmes 24 sts 9 ssk k1 k2tog k1 four qmes 16 sts finishing cut yarn leaving a long tail and use a tapestry needle to pull yarn through all live sqtches secure and weave in all ends give the hat a couple of good tugs in each direcqon to help se`le the sqtches block if desired affix a pom pom if desired skull fair isle toque © stashbusters union 2025 3 chart 8 7 6 5 4
